title: Warehouse Quality Assistant
description_html:
Our Story:

The a2 Milk Company, driven by science and a pioneering spirit, disrupted the dairy and infant milk formula industry. Our vision is to create an A1-free world where dairy nourishes all people and our planet.

The a2 Milk Company seeks to achieve this through the naturally occurring a2 Milk® difference and by bringing a more sustainable approach to dairy. 

 

About the role: 

Reporting to the Warehouse Manager and based at our Pokeno site, you will play a critical role in maintaining high quality standards across our warehouse operations. You’ll be responsible for ensuring all inbound and outbound goods meet quality, compliance, and regulatory requirements, while supporting production and inventory accuracy in a fast-paced manufacturing environment.

 

More specifically, you will be involved in:

  • Inspecting inbound and outbound goods to ensure they are free from damage and foreign matter (quality control, warehouse quality, GMP)
  • Completing and maintaining accurate documentation for all warehouse movements, including receipting, dispatch paperwork, and seal control (warehouse administration, compliance)
  • Creating, checking, and confirming picks against production orders and shipping documentation (order accuracy, production support)
  • Updating scheduling systems with booking statuses and movement information (ERP systems, warehouse systems)
  • Conducting quality checks, label verification, inventory enquiries, and registering improvements or investigations in Promapp (continuous improvement, inventory accuracy)
  • Maintaining exceptional cleanliness and housekeeping standards across the warehouse and facilities (5S, hygiene, food safety)
  • Supporting the wider warehouse team with daily tasks, enquiries, data entry, and workload coordination

 

What you will bring

  • At least 1 year’s experience in a warehousing or logistics environment
  • Strong attention to detail with a quality-focused mindset
  • Good written and spoken English skills
  • Strong organisational and time-management skills
  • Knowledge of quality systems, compliance, and health & safety practices
  • A hands-on approach and physical capability for warehouse tasks
  • A willingness to learn and contribute to a high-performance team

 

Preferred but not essential:

  • Experience in a manufacturing or food production environment
  • Forklift licence
  • Experience using ERP systems such as Microsoft Dynamics NAV (or similar)
  • Familiarity with health & safety standards


Find out more about our great benefits on our Careers Page.

title: Food Safety Officer
description_html:
Our Story:

The a2 Milk Company, driven by science and a pioneering spirit, disrupted the dairy and infant milk formula industry. Our vision is to create an A1-free world where dairy nourishes all people and our planet.

The a2 Milk Company seeks to achieve this through the naturally occurring a2 Milk® difference and by bringing a more sustainable approach to dairy. 

 

About the role:

Based at our Pokeno manufacturing site, you will play a critical role in implementing food safety strategies and ensuring consistent compliance across the site. You will be a key driver of proactive food safety controls and continuous improvement within the factory.

 

More specifically, you will be involved in:

  • Implementing and verifying factory food safety programs including cGMP, HACCP, zoning, pathogen management and foreign matter control
  • Developing and delivering food safety training and building capability across the site
  • Conducting GMP and food safety audits, and driving corrective and preventative actions
  • Verifying the effective execution of the HACCP system and pre-requisite programs
  • Analysing trends, data and results to identify risks and drive continuous improvement initiatives
  • Supporting investigation and resolution of food safety incidents using structured problem-solving tools
  • Driving a proactive food safety culture with the goal of zero food safety defects

 

What you will bring:

 

  • Experience in a food manufacturing environment, ideally within infant nutrition 
  • Strong working knowledge of food safety systems, HACCP, cGMP and regulatory requirements
  • Background in food science, food microbiology or food processing
  • Experience establishing, leading or supporting HACCP studies
  • Knowledge of zoning principles and pathogen monitoring programs
  • Confident communication and training delivery skills, with the ability to influence on the factory floor
  • A proactive, detail-focused mindset with strong problem-solving capability

 

What we offer

  • Medical, Life & Income Protection Insurance.
  • Annual Bonus.
  • A supportive team culture with learning and development opportunities.
  • Free breakfast and lunch provided in our onsite cafeteria.
  • Subsidised gym membership.
  • Social club.


Apply now

If this sounds like you, please submit your CV. Shortlisted candidates will be contacted for a phone screening.

 

Find out more about our great benefits on our Careers Page.

title: Science Project Administrator
description_html:
Our Story:

The a2 Milk Company, driven by science and a pioneering spirit, disrupted the dairy and infant milk formula industry. Our vision is to create an A1-free world where dairy nourishes all people and our planet.

The a2 Milk Company seeks to achieve this through the naturally occurring a2 Milk® difference and by bringing a more sustainable approach to dairy. 

 

About the role:
 Based in our Auckland office, the Science Project Administrator will play a critical role in supporting and coordinating science activities to ensure projects are delivered on-time, within scope, and within budget. You will work closely with the Senior Research Manager and cross-functional teams to streamline project administration and maintain project excellence.

 

More specifically, you will be involved in:

  • Creating and maintaining project documentation, practices, and policies.
  • Coordinating internal resources (supply chain, legal, finance, marketing) and external vendors to enable smooth project execution.
  • Tracking and reporting on project deliverables, risks, budgets, and timelines.
  • Organising team travel, expenses, and conference participation.
  • Acting as the primary administrative contact for external service providers.
  • Coordinating shipping and logistics for clinical and preclinical study samples, including liaising with couriers, customs authorities, and research partners.
  • Ensuring agreements, insurance, and contractual obligations are managed and executed in collaboration with Legal and Finance teams.
  • Supporting budget management and alignment of project activities with financial reporting requirements.
  • Contributing to R&D Tax Initiative documentation and updates as required.

 

What you will bring:

  • 2+ years of experience in project and financial management roles, preferably in a science-related environment.
  • Proven ability to manage multiple projects, track budgets, and deliver high-quality results.
  • Strong project portfolio management, including risk analysis, problem-solving, and mitigation planning.
  • Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate across teams.
  • Proficiency with MS Office Suite and project management tools.
  • Self-motivated, decisive, adaptable, and detail-focused.

 

We are committed to enhancing our team members' work-life wellbeing with leading policies and practices on flexible work, parental leave, family care, and family wellbeing. This role can be worked flexibly, ensuring a healthy balance between work and personal life. Our family-friendly culture is designed to support workforce participation, career development, and mental health and wellbeing.

 

Find out more about our great benefits on our Careers Page.

title: Group Financial Accountant
description_html:
Our Story

At The a2 Milk Company, we’re doing dairy differently.
Founded on science and driven by a pioneering spirit, we’re proud to be a global ASX and NZX-listed organisation with a strong footprint across Australia, New Zealand, Asia, and beyond. Our purpose is simple but powerful to create an A1-free world where dairy nourishes all people and the planet.

As we continue to grow globally, we’re looking for a junior to intermediate Group Financial Accountant who is keen to build a strong technical foundation, gain exposure to group reporting, and grow their career within a supportive, high-performing finance team.


The Opportunity

This role is ideal for an early-career accountant who has recently completed their CA or CPA qualification or is close to doing so and looking to step into a global finance environment where learning, development and progression are genuinely supported.

Reporting to the Group Financial Reporting Manager, you’ll play a key role in end-of-month processing, group reporting and analysis, while gaining hands-on exposure to half yearly external reporting, consolidation, treasury, fixed assets, leases and foreign currency accounting across an international business. You’ll be supported by an experienced finance team and exposed to projects that will stretch your skills and accelerate your development. This is a varied role in a small and engaged team that offers a rewarding finance career in a growing global FMCG company


What You’ll Be Doing

You’ll be involved in:

  • Supporting end-of-month close activities, including journals, reconciliations and reporting
  • Liaising with the various regional and function finance teams and building strong relationships
  • Maintaining group fixed assets, intangibles and lease accounting
  • Assisting with group consolidations, intercompany eliminations and reconciliations
  • Supporting foreign currency revaluations and FX reporting
  • Contributing to half-year and year-end reporting processes
  • Assisting with audit and treasury activities
  • Getting involved in process improvement initiatives to streamline finance operations

This role provides excellent exposure across group finance and will evolve as your capability grows.

 

About You

You’re curious, detail-oriented and motivated to learn. You enjoy working in a collaborative team and want to understand the “why” behind the numbers.

You’ll likely bring:

  • A degree in Accounting, Finance or Commerce
  • Qualified or currently working towards the final stages of CA or CPA
  • 1–3 years’ experience in a finance or accounting role (industry or professional services)
  • A solid understanding of IFRS (NZX/ASX listed exposure a plus)
  • Strong Excel skills and an interest in ERP systems (Oracle exposure advantageous)
  • A proactive mindset and willingness to ask questions and take ownership as you grow
  • Enjoy a fast-paced environment, where the work at times is a bit ambiguous and requires a problem-solving approach.


If you’re looking for a role where you can build deep technical capability, gain global exposure and grow your accounting career, we’d love to hear from you.


Why join a2 Milk?

The a2 Milk Company Australia is a certified Family Inclusive Workplace committed to improving our team members work life wellbeing with leading policies and practices on flexible work, parental leave, family care and family wellbeing. This role can be worked flexibly, allowing us to support our team members in balancing their personal and professional lives. Our family-friendly culture aims to foster workforce participation, career development, and mental health and wellbeing.

Find out more about our great benefits on our Careers Page.

title: Inventory Controller
description_html:
Our Story:

The a2 Milk Company is driven by science and a pioneering spirit, having disrupted the dairy and infant milk formula industry. Their vision is to create an A1-free world where dairy nourishes people and the planet. As part of this transition, we’re embracing new opportunities for innovation, sustainability, and growth, while continuing to deliver high-quality products and a great workplace culture.

 

Your role:

As we continue to grow, we’re looking for an Inventory Controller to join our New Zealand-based Supply Chain team, based at Pokeno, Waikato.

 

Reporting to the Site Supply Chain Manager, you’ll play a critical role in ensuring inventory accuracy, optimisation, and visibility across our operations. This role is key to enabling efficient manufacturing, meeting customer demand, and supporting broader supply chain performance while minimising cost, waste, and risk.

 

You’ll work closely with manufacturing, quality, technical, logistics, and external partners to ensure inventory is well controlled, compliant, and continuously improving.

 

More specifically, you will be involved in:    

 

  • Maintain accurate inventory records across ERP and inventory management systems
  • Conduct cycle counts and stocktakes, investigating and reconciling discrepancies
  • Analyse inventory data to identify trends, risks, and opportunities for optimisation
  • Coordinate with procurement, production, and logistics teams to support timely replenishment
  • Manage slow-moving, obsolete, and excess inventory to minimise write-offs and waste
  • Prepare inventory reporting including stock valuation, ageing, accuracy, and turnover
  • Support S&OP processes through inventory forecasting and gap analysis
  • Track and report on key inventory KPIs such as accuracy, shrinkage, and turnover
  • Support continuous improvement initiatives, automation, and system enhancements
  • Ensure compliance with health, safety, quality, and regulatory requirements

 

What you will bring:

 

  • 2–5+ years’ experience in inventory control, warehouse operations, or supply chain roles
  • Broad knowledge of inventory management, supply chain, and logistics processes
  • Experience working with ERP systems (SAP, Oracle, or similar preferred)
  • Advanced Excel capability with strong analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Excellent attention to detail and strong organisational skills
  • Ability to collaborate effectively across manufacturing, quality, and supply chain teams
  • Diploma or Degree in Supply Chain Management, Logistics, or a related discipline (preferred)

title: Senior Capex & Strategic Projects Manager
description_html:
Our Story:

The a2 Milk Company, driven by science and a pioneering spirit, disrupted the dairy and infant milk formula industry. Our vision is to create an A1-free world where dairy nourishes all people and our planet.

The a2 Milk Company seeks to achieve this through the naturally occurring a2 Milk® difference and by bringing a more sustainable approach to dairy. 

 

The role:

This is a senior, high-impact role responsible for the end-to-end governance, planning, and execution of major capital investments and strategic manufacturing initiatives across a2MC’s global manufacturing portfolio.

 

You will play a pivotal role in ensuring capital and cross-functional initiatives deliver on scope, schedule, budget, quality, safety, and compliance, while strengthening the connection between Group Manufacturing strategy and site execution.

 

More specifically, you will be involved in:

  • Leading capital planning, portfolio governance, and stage-gate approvals across manufacturing sites
  • Establishing and governing project charters, scopes, cost plans, schedules, change control, and reporting
  • Managing complex capex projects in live manufacturing environments, including FAT/SAT, commissioning, and operational readiness
  • Coordinating engineering consultants, OEMs, contractors, and internal stakeholders across Engineering, Operations, Finance, Procurement, and Quality
  • Driving risk management, safety in design, HAZOPs, contractor safety, and compliance with food manufacturing and regulatory standards
  • Delivering cross-functional strategic projects focused on productivity, automation, OEE improvement, digital transformation, and network optimisation

 

What you will bring:

  • A Bachelor’s degree in Engineering (Mechanical, Chemical, Process, Industrial, or similar)
  • 5+ years’ experience leading capital projects within food, dairy, FMCG, pharmaceutical, or regulated manufacturing environments
  • Strong financial and commercial acumen, including capex budgeting, forecasting, cost control, and ROI analysis
  • Deep experience with project governance frameworks (e.g. stage-gate, PMBOK, PRINCE2) and disciplined reporting
  • Proven ability to manage contractors, engineering consultants, and OEMs while influencing senior internal stakeholders
  • Experience working across multi-site or group manufacturing environments (highly desirable)
  • Exposure to automation, utilities, packaging, or infant formula manufacturing projects (advantageous)
  • A safety-first mindset, strong problem-solving capability, and the ability to thrive in complex, fast-moving environments

title: Production Operator - School Leavers Welcome!
description_html:
• Location: Smeaton Grange, NSW | Growing Global FMCG Company
  • Train on the job in an inclusive and supportive environment
  • Shifts: Week-on / Week-off rotation (Day & Afternoon) No night shifts. No Sunday work. 


Our Story

At The a2 Milk Company, we do dairy differently. We’re proud to be one of Australia’s leading milk brands built on science, purpose and innovation. Our a2 Milk® contains only the A2 beta-casein protein, making it easier for more people to enjoy dairy.  As a growing global business, we’re passionate about developing people early in their careers and creating safe, inclusive workplaces where everyone belongs.


The Opportunity

Are you taking a gap year, recently finished school, or looking to gain real-world experience before your next step?

This is a hands-on opportunity to join a high-performing production team where you’ll learn how a global dairy business operates from milk intake to packaging all while working alongside experienced operators, leaders and technical specialists.

No previous dairy experience? No problem. We’ll train you.

 

What You’ll Be Doing 

  • Learning how milk products are made in a modern dairy facility
  • Working with friendly, experienced operators who support your development
  • Rotating between day and afternoon shifts (week on / week off) with15% loading on afternoon shifts
  • Supporting daily production operations in a modern dairy environment
  • Learning how high-quality milk products are made, packed and distributed
  • Working safely and collaboratively as part of a supportive team
  • Gaining exposure to food manufacturing, quality standards and teamwork
  • Building practical skills, you can take into future study or career pathways

 

What We’re Looking For

  • Recent school leavers or early career starters
  • A positive attitude and willingness to learn
  • Reliability, teamwork and a strong safety mindset
  • Comfort working on rotating day/afternoon shifts
  • No experience needed - just enthusiasm and commitment

 

Why Join a2 Milk?

  • Permanent role with stability and security
  • No night shifts and no Sunday work
  • Supportive, inclusive team culture
  • On-the-job training and real career pathway
  • Work for a purpose-led, global brand that values people

 

Start Your Career Doing Dairy Differently

If you’re ready to take your first step into the workforce and want to learn from the best, we’d love to hear from you. Apply now and start your career with The a2 Milk Company. 

Must have permanent working rights in Australia 


 


Find out more about our great benefits on our Careers Page.

Why Join a2 Milk?


Permanent role with stability and security

Start Your Career Doing Dairy Differently

If you’re ready to take your first step into the workforce and want to learn from the best, we’d love to hear from you. Apply now and start your career with The a2 Milk Company. 

Must have permanent working rights in Australia

title: Performance & Reward Analyst
description_html:
Our Story:

At The a2 Milk Company (a2MC), we’re driven by science, curiosity and a belief that doing things differently can make a meaningful impact. As an ASX and NZX listed organisation with growing global operations, we’re proud of our pioneering spirit and our purpose to create an A1-protein-free world where dairy nourishes all people and the planet.

As we continue to scale globally, we’re building strong, future-focused People & Culture foundations and that’s where you come in.

The Opportunity

This is an exciting early-career opportunity for a Performance & Reward Analyst looking to move from a consulting environment into an in-house role, gaining exposure to global reward, benefits and performance frameworks in an ASX-listed/NZX-listed environment.

Reporting to the Group Head of Performance & Reward, you’ll play a key role in supporting remuneration, benefits and performance initiatives across multiple geographies learning from experienced leaders while building your technical depth and commercial confidence.

If you love working with data, excel modelling and turning insights into action, this role will give you the breadth, structure and growth in an inhouse dynamic commercial environment that you’re looking for.

What You’ll Be Doing

Across Performance, Reward and Benefits, you’ll support the delivery and continuous improvement of our global frameworks, including:

Reward & Remuneration

  • Supporting job grading, benchmarking and remuneration range development across markets
  • Assisting with salary surveys (Korn Ferry), annual salary review cycles and incentive calculations
  • Preparing Excel-based models, spreadsheets and reward letters
  • Supporting compliance activities including modern award classifications and WGEA reporting

Performance

  • Supporting performance cycles, calibration processes and reporting
  • Preparing Excel and PowerPoint materials to support leader decision-making
  • Acting as a super-user for performance modules within Oracle HCM

Benefits

  • Assisting with global benefits administration and communications
  • Supporting wellbeing initiatives and researching new benefit offerings
  • Responding to benefits-related queries from leaders and team members

Data & Reporting

  • Producing ad-hoc reports, dashboards and insights for P&C and stakeholders
  • Supporting continuous improvement of reporting capability across the Group

 

What You’ll Bring

We’re looking for an analytical and detail-driven early-career analyst who is ready to step into an in-house role and develop a rewarding career in our People and Culture team.

You’ll ideally have:

  • 12+ months’ experience in a consulting, advisory or analyst role (HR, reward, data or people analytics)
  • Strong Excel capability -including XLOOKUP/VLOOKUP, Pivot Tables and array formulas such as SUMIF / AVERAGEIF
  • A genuine interest in reward, performance, benefits and people data
  • Confidence working with numbers and translating data into clear insights
  • Strong attention to detail and comfort handling sensitive information
  • Clear written and verbal communication skills

Nice to have (but not essential):

  • Exposure to Tier 1 HRIS platforms (Oracle HCM, Workday or SuccessFactors)
  • Power BI or data visualisation experience
  • Familiarity with job evaluation frameworks

 

Why Join a2MC?

  • Move in-house from consulting and gain end-to-end commercial exposure
  • Work across global reward, benefits and performance frameworks
  • Be part of a growing ASX & NZX listed organisation with international reach
  • Learn directly from experienced leaders in a supportive, values-led team
  • Flexible ways of working, wellbeing initiatives and an inclusive culture
  • A genuine opportunity to build your career in Performance & Reward


If you’re early in your career, love Excel, enjoy working with data and want to grow your impact inside a global organisation, we’d love to hear from you.

Find out more about our great benefits on our Careers Page.

title: Supply Chain Manager
description_html:
Our Story:

We’re excited to share that our business has recently joined the a2 Milk Company family. Formerly known as Yashili Dairy NZ Ltd, we are now operating as a2 Nutritionals NZ Limited, based in Pokeno.

 

The a2 Milk Company, driven by science and a pioneering spirit, disrupted the dairy and infant milk formula industry. Our vision is to create an A1-free world where dairy nourishes all people and our planet.

The a2 Milk Company seeks to achieve this through the naturally occurring a2 Milk® difference and by bringing a more sustainable approach to dairy. 

 

Your Impact:

Reporting to the Site General Manager and based at our Pokeno site, you will be responsible for leading and managing the end-to-end supply chain, warehousing, and logistics operations for our New Zealand infant formula manufacturing site.

 

In this critical leadership role, you will ensure the safe, accurate, compliant, and cost-efficient flow of raw materials and finished goods, while driving continuous improvement, resilience, and service excellence in a highly regulated environment.

 

More specifically, you will be involved in:

 

  • Leading the Sales & Operations Planning (S&OP) process, including demand planning, supply planning, scenario analysis, and cross-functional alignment
  • Managing inventory, warehousing, and logistics operations, including ERP inventory accuracy, stock reconciliation, warehouse optimisation, and third-party logistics providers
  • Overseeing production planning, ensuring material availability aligns with manufacturing schedules and infant formula–specific quality and traceability requirements
  • Procuring ingredients, packaging, and indirect materials, managing replenishment cycles through ERP/MRP systems, and negotiating supplier agreements
  • Ensuring regulatory, quality, and food safety compliance, including FSANZ Infant Formula Standards, GB standards, and full end-to-end traceability
  • Identifying and mitigating supply chain risks, leading contingency planning for disruptions, recalls, or plant shutdowns
  • Driving systems improvement and digital enablement, including ERP/MRP optimisation, automation, and supply chain analytics
  • Leading, developing, and mentoring a high-performing supply chain and warehouse team, while fostering a strong safety and compliance culture


What you will bring:

  • Extensive experience in supply chain management within infant formula, dairy, or FMCG manufacturing environments
  • Proven leadership of S&OP, MRP, and planning processes in complex, regulated supply chains
  • Strong background in procurement, managing large portfolios of globally sourced ingredients and packaging materials
  • Experience managing warehousing and logistics operations, including third-party providers (preferred)
  • High level of capability in ERP and WMS systems, with a continuous improvement mindset
  • Excellent stakeholder management and communication skills, including working with suppliers, regulators, logistics partners, and cross-functional teams
  • A minimum of 10 years’ experience in supply chain roles, with 5+ years’ experience in procurement and planning within complex environments

 

What we offer

  • Medical, Life & Income Protection Insurance.
  • Annual Bonus.
  • A supportive team culture with learning and development opportunities.
  • Free breakfast and lunch provided in our onsite cafeteria.
  • Subsidised gym membership.
  • Social club.

title: People and Culture Partner
description_html:
• A true People & Culture Partner role with real impact across our corporate and multi-site AU operations.
  • Work with our Leaders to support growth, wellbeing and sustainable ways or working
  • Build your career in a growing, global ASX-listed FMCG company with a strong values-led culture

 

At The a2 Milk Company (a2MC), we believe that people do their best work when they feel supported, trusted and genuinely valued.

Driven by science and a pioneering spirit, a2MC was founded on a bold idea to create an A1-protein-free world where dairy nourishes all people and our planet. Today, we’re a purpose-led, growing global FMCG business with a focus on quality and by promoting a more sustainable approach to dairy.

We’re now looking for an experienced People & Culture Partner to join our Australian People and Culture team. Working across multiple sites, this is a varied role for someone who enjoys autonomy, pace and partnering closely with leaders in both operational and office-based environments.


About the role

If you are looking to kick off the new year with a hands-on, high-exposure People & Culture Partner role supporting leaders across production operations, supply chain and corporate functions nationally, then this could be for you.

Reporting to the Head of People & Culture – ANZ, you’ll work closely with leaders to deliver practical, people-first solutions that support performance, engagement and growth while continuing to develop your own partnering capability in a complex, evolving business.

If you enjoy creating real impact, autonomy and being close to the action, you will love this role.


What you’ll be involved in

  • Partnering with leaders across multi-site production and corporate environments on day-to-day people matters
  • Supporting leaders with employee relations, performance conversations, investigations and issue resolution
  • Delivering core employee lifecycle activities including performance, engagement, development and succession
  • Supporting leaders through change in a fast-moving operational environment to develop capability to support a ‘leader-led’ business culture
  • Contributing to people initiatives that build capability, inclusion, wellbeing and leadership effectiveness
  • Living and role-modelling our BOLD values in how you partner, influence and lead


More about you

You’re a hands-on, commercially minded People & Culture Partner who thrives in environments where strategy meets day-to-day operations and where relationships, credibility and impact really matter.

What excites you about this role is the opportunity to work in a true partnering model, supporting operational and corporate leaders across Australia, while being exposed to the full breadth of the people agenda in a growing, ASX-listed organisation. In a lean, experienced People & Culture team, you’ll have the opportunity to build your profile, deepen your capability and influence outcomes, not just advise from the sidelines.

Your ideal background and what you get excited about!

  • 3–4+ years’ experience as a HR Generalist, Advisor or emerging P&C Partner, ideally within a large, complex or multi-site organisation
  • Experience supporting operational environments such as production, supply chain, distribution, retail, FMCG or corporate head office functions
  • A Culture Champion who is confident handling ER/IR matters including performance management, grievances, flexible work arrangements, leave management and workers compensation, with empathy and sound judgement
  • Exposure to structured people frameworks (performance reviews, remuneration cycles, talent or capability frameworks), with an interest in understanding how these connect to governance and business outcomes
  • Energised by variety, pace and balancing operational needs with people outcomes. You have a collaborative mindset comfortable working alongside senior Stakeholders and specialist teams, while owning and delivering people initiatives at the frontline
  • Most importantly, you care about people and want to grow your career in a business where People and Culture is valued as a true partner.


Why Join The a2 Milk Company.

  • We pride ourselves on being an inclusive people-first, values led environment where not only your contribution matters, but you do too!
  • We offer Flexibility, autonomy and support to grow your career
  • We have inclusive benefits, mobile and laptop, full support via our wellbeing programs and an annual wellbeing day
  • Not only are you joining a collaborative People & Culture team with a strong voice in the business, but this role has ongoing career growth and potential to lead people, exciting projects and continuous improvement programs.  

 

Find out more about our great benefits on our Careers Page.

title: Site Quality Manager
description_html:
Our Story:
The a2 Milk Company, driven by science and a pioneering spirit, disrupted the dairy and infant milk formula industry. Our vision is to create an A1-free world where dairy nourishes all people and our planet. The a2 Milk Company seeks to achieve this through the naturally occurring a2 Milk® difference and by bringing a more sustainable approach to dairy.

 

The role:
Based at our manufacturing facility in Pokeno, you will provide site-wide quality leadership, ensuring world-class food safety, product quality, and regulatory compliance across infant nutrition powder manufacturing.

 

As Site Quality Manager, you will lead all site quality functions and partner closely with Operations, Supply Chain, Regulatory Affairs, and Product Development to ensure products manufactured at Pokeno consistently meet company specifications, global regulatory requirements, and customer expectations—delivering products trusted by parents and consumers globally. 

 

More specifically, you will be responsible for:

  • Leading the site Quality Department, including Quality Systems, Microbiology, Validation & Change Control, Compliance, Product Release, and QC operations across drying and canning.
  • Owning site-wide food safety and regulatory compliance, including Codex, MPI, SAMR (China), FDA (US), and EU requirements for infant milk formula.
  • Driving a strong Quality Culture across the site, embedding “right first time” and continuous improvement practices.
  • Overseeing finished product, raw material, and packaging release processes for infant nutrition powders.
  • Leading site readiness for regulatory inspections, customer audits, and certifications (e.g. FSSC 22000, ISO, GMP).
  • Partnering with Operations to optimise manufacturing processes while safeguarding food safety and quality.
  • Leading root cause analysis, CAPA, and continuous improvement initiatives to reduce cost of poor quality.
  • Developing and leading a high-performing Quality team (~20+ FTEs across shifts), building technical capability and future-ready leadership.
      

What You Will Bring:

  • 12–15 years’ experience in Quality, Food Safety, or Regulatory Compliance within dairy, infant nutrition, or pharmaceutical manufacturing.
  • Proven experience in a senior site quality leadership role, managing multidisciplinary teams across laboratory, compliance, and operations interfaces.
  • Deep knowledge of infant milk formula (IMF) regulations including Codex, SAMR, FDA, EU, and MPI.
  • Demonstrated expertise in HACCP, food safety systems, auditing, and regulatory inspection management.
  • Experience overseeing product release for high-risk categories such as infant nutrition powders.
  • Strong stakeholder management and influencing capability across corporate teams, regulators, and customers.
  • A Bachelor’s degree in Food Science, Dairy Science, Microbiology, Chemistry, Engineering, or a related discipline (Master’s preferred).

 

We are committed to enhancing our team members' work-life wellbeing with leading policies and practices on flexible work, parental leave, family care, and family wellbeing. This role can be worked flexibly, ensuring a healthy balance between work and personal life. Our family-friendly culture is designed to support workforce participation, career development, and mental health and wellbeing. Find out more about our great benefits on our Careers Page.

 

 

Find out more about our great benefits on our Careers Page.

title: Supply Chain Finance Analyst
description_html:
Our Story:

 

The a2 Milk Company, driven by science and a pioneering spirit, disrupted the dairy and infant milk formula industry. Our vision is to create an A1-free world where dairy nourishes all people and our planet.

The a2 Milk Company seeks to achieve this through the naturally occurring a2 Milk® difference and by bringing a more sustainable approach to dairy. 

 

Your Impact:

 

Reporting to the Supply Chain Finance Manager – Powders and based in Auckland, you will sit at the intersection of finance, supply chain and technology, delivering insightful, accurate and actionable analysis that transforms complex data into meaningful insights and drives smarter operational and commercial decisions across our global supply chain.

 

More specifically, you will be involved in:

 

  • Preparing quarterly accounting papers and maintaining COGS per-unit rate workbooks
  • Providing inputs for cash flow reporting and supporting liquidity analysis
  • Developing and setting up market commodity models for pricing and risk management 
  • Month-end reporting, variance analysis, and financial insights across logistics, COGS, material pricing, and inventory
  • Preparing balance sheet reconciliations, journals, accruals, CAPEX reports, and management reports
  • Supporting forecasting and budgeting in collaboration with procurement and supply chain operations teams
  • Inventory control activities including reconciliations, provisions, and alignment with S&OP processes
  • Supporting CAPEX submissions, continuous improvement initiatives, and supply chain-related projects
  • Partnering with stakeholders on contract reviews, cost optimisation, and financial decision support
  • Driving process improvements through system enhancements, advanced analytics, and emerging technologies (including AI)
  • Supporting half-year and year-end financial close and external audit requirements

 

What you will bring:

 

  • Experience in supply chain or operational finance, ideally within a large FMCG or consumer goods environment
  • Strong understanding of financial accounting principles and standards
  • Advanced Excel and analytical skills, with the ability to translate data into insights
  • Experience with ERP/EPM systems (Oracle experience highly regarded)
  • Proven capability in month-end close, journal posting, reporting, and reconciliations
  • Strong commercial acumen, attention to detail, and a continuous improvement mindset
  • Excellent communication skills and the ability to work autonomously in a fast-paced, global environment
  • A Bachelor’s degree in Accounting or Finance (mandatory)

 

We are committed to enhancing our team members' work-life wellbeing with leading policies and practices on flexible work, parental leave, family care, and family wellbeing. This role can be worked flexibly, ensuring a healthy balance between work and personal life. Our family-friendly culture is designed to support workforce participation, career development, and mental health and wellbeing.

 

Find out more about our great benefits on our Careers Page.

title: Digital & Ecommerce Manager 8-month Fixed-Term Contract | Maternity Leave Cover
description_html:
Our Story

At The a2 Milk Company (a2MC), we’re driven by science, guided by purpose and inspired by the belief that better dairy can make a meaningful difference to people’s lives. As a growing global business, our digital and eCommerce channels play a critical role in how we connect with families, build trust and fuel sustainable growth across international markets.

We’re now looking for a Digital & Ecommerce Manager to join our ANZ team as part of our International Marketing & Ecommerce team on an 8-month fixed-term maternity leave cover, based in our vibrant Southbank offices.  This role can also be available 4 days per week and can start immediately.


Your opportunity

This role is all about impact. You’ll step into a pivotal position, leading our Infant Milk Formula digital ecosystem across our ANZ region during a period of growth, momentum and evolution. From websites and SEO to GEO, influencer content and eCommerce performance, you’ll bring energy, clarity and commercial thinking to our “always-on” digital activity.

Working closely with global stakeholders, agency partners and internal brand teams, you’ll help elevate how we show up online ensuring our digital platforms are optimised, engaging and delivering against clear performance outcomes.

What you’ll be doing

  • Leading the update and optimisation of international websites, ensuring best-in-class user experience and alignment with brand direction
  • Owning SEO, SEM and GEO strategy and execution in partnership with specialist agencies to drive visibility and performance in priority markets
  • Driving performance across our digital platforms, including traffic growth, conversion optimisation and average order value
  • Planning and executing email marketing and automated campaigns to support revenue growth
  • Partnering with eCommerce and brand teams to optimise online retail platforms (including Coles, Woolworths, Amazon and Chemist Warehouse)
  • Managing always-on social media and content, including brand, influencer and creator activity, bringing a fresh, engaging perspective
  • Tracking, analysing and optimising digital and Ecommerce performance through robust KPIs, dashboards and a test-and-learn mindset
  • Managing digital budgets responsibly and ensuring agency deliverables are aligned to brand and business objectives


What you’ll bring

  • Strong end-to-end digital marketing and eCommerce experience (ideally 3+ years)
  • Deep understanding of SEO, SEM, paid social and content performance metrics
  • Hands-on experience leading influencer and creator content from concept to delivery
  • A highly analytical mindset with the ability to turn data into actionable insights
  • Confident stakeholder management skills and a collaborative, solutions-focused approach
  • A genuine passion for digital innovation and helping others lift digital capability
  • Experience in agency environments, eCommerce trading platforms will be highly regarded.


Why join a2MC?

  • Be part of a values-led, inclusive and people-first culture
  • Work with a globally connected marketing and eCommerce team
  • Enjoy a modern Southbank office, flexible ways of working and a supportive environment
  • Make a real impact in a role where your ideas, energy and expertise matter


Find out more about our great benefits on our Careers Page.

title: Food Safety Manager
description_html:
Our Story:

The a2 Milk Company, driven by science and a pioneering spirit, disrupted the dairy and infant milk formula industry. Our vision is to create an A1-free world where dairy nourishes all people and our planet.

The a2 Milk Company seeks to achieve this through the naturally occurring a2 Milk® difference and by bringing a more sustainable approach to dairy. 

 

The role: 

As the Food Safety Manager, based in Auckland, you will work closely with cross-functional teams, factories, and third-party manufacturers to strengthen and elevate our food safety culture. You will champion best-practice standards and guide teams to meet and exceed a2MC’s food safety expectations.

 

You will play a pivotal role in shaping and leading the food safety strategy across The a2 Milk Company. This includes providing expert leadership on food safety requirements for all our products, projects, and installations, and driving programs and continuous improvement initiatives that support our goal of achieving zero food-safety-related defects across our supply chain and partner network.

 

More specifically, you will:

  • Establish and maintain Food Safety standards and compliance requirements across a2MC.
  • Develop and implement food safety strategies, programs, and governance frameworks that ensure zero food safety defects.
  • Provide technical expertise on food safety requirements for all products and projects.
  • Lead the development of pre-HACCP assessments for innovations, renovations, and improvement initiatives to mitigate allergen, chemical, microbiological, nutritional, and physical hazards.
  • Support factories and third-party manufacturers (3PMs) in resolving food safety issues using structured problem-solving methodologies.
  • Drive continuous improvement initiatives across the supply chain and operations.
  • Institutionalise standard routines and pre-requisite programs and verify effective implementation with factories and 3PMs.
  • Lead and verify the implementation of the HACCP Plan across all relevant operations.
  • Design and deliver training programs to uplift food safety capability across the organisation.
  • Analyse results, trends, and insights to develop ongoing improvement plans in food safety performance.

 

What you will bring:

  • Broad knowledge of food processing, food safety systems, and current GMP
  • A tertiary qualification in Food Science, Food Technology, Microbiology, or a related discipline is preferred.
  • Expertise in food science, food microbiology, and applied food safety principles.
  • Strong capability with problem-solving tools and structured investigation methods.
  • Proven leadership skills with the ability to influence, guide, and uplift capability across teams.
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills, with strong stakeholder-engagement experience.
  • High attention to detail and the ability to work collaboratively across diverse teams and external partners.
  • Experience in a food manufacturing environment (mandatory).
  • Experience in infant nutrition or closely regulated nutrition categories (mandatory).
  • Demonstrated experience establishing and leading HACCP studies, and strong working knowledge of Pre-requisite Programs, Zoning, and Pathogen Monitoring.

 

We are committed to enhancing our team members' work-life wellbeing with leading policies and practices on flexible work, parental leave, family care, and family wellbeing. This role can be worked flexibly, ensuring a healthy balance between work and personal life. Our family-friendly culture is designed to support workforce participation, career development, and mental health and wellbeing.

 

Find out more about our great benefits on our Careers Page.

title: Senior Manager - Quality Systems
description_html:
Our Story:

The a2 Milk Company, driven by science and a pioneering spirit, disrupted the dairy and infant milk formula industry. Our vision is to create an A1-free world where dairy nourishes all people and our planet.

The a2 Milk Company seeks to achieve this through the naturally occurring a2 Milk® difference and by bringing a more sustainable approach to dairy. 

 

Your Impact:

Reporting to the Head of Quality – ANZ and based at our Auckland CBD office, you will play a critical leadership role in shaping, embedding, and elevating our Quality and Management Systems across the ANZ business. 

 

You will be responsible for driving Manufacturing Excellence, ensuring regulatory and certification compliance, and enabling a culture of zero-defect delivery across our operations and supply chain.

More specifically, you will be involved in:

  • Establishing the framework and leading the implementation of the Quality Management System to achieve full compliance and zero defect.
  • Managing all relevant regulatory, local and global operational instructions, policies, standards, and guidelines.
  • Overseeing site certifications (RMP, GACC, SAMR, FSSC, EU listing, Organic, Halal) including audits and new certifications.
  • Leading internal audits across Head Office, factories, third-party manufacturers, licensees, and distribution centres to identify gaps and drive continuous improvement.

 

What you will bring:

  • 10+ years’ experience in Quality, Food Safety or Supplier Quality Assurance within food, dairy, or pharma.
  • Strong knowledge of global food safety standards including CFDA, MPI, Codex, FDA, EU, and FSSC/ISO 22000.
  • Demonstrated capability in auditing, TPM, root cause analysis, and implementing management systems.
  • Ability to influence and collaborate across global supply chains with strong leadership and communication skills.
  • Bachelor’s degree in Food Science, Dairy Science, Chemistry, Engineering, or related discipline (Master’s preferred).


We are committed to enhancing our team members' work-life wellbeing with leading policies and practices on flexible work, parental leave, family care, and family wellbeing. This role can be worked flexibly, ensuring a healthy balance between work and personal life. Our family-friendly culture is designed to support workforce participation, career development, and mental health and wellbeing.

 

Find out more about our great benefits on our Careers Page.

title: Safety & Environment Manager
description_html:
• Play a key leadership role driving environmental excellence and safety at our flagship manufacturing site
  • Work for a global ASX leader in dairy and champion environmental management.
  • Work with a passionate, values-led organisation driving positive change in dairy.

 

Our Story

The a2 Milk Company, driven by science and a pioneering spirit, disrupted the dairy and infant milk formula industry. Our vision is to create an A1-free world where dairy nourishes all people and our planet. We seek to achieve this through the naturally occurring a2 Milk® difference and by promoting a more sustainable and safety driven approach to our dairy production.


More about the Role:

This is an excited opportunity where you will help shape the future of safety and sustainability at our Liquid Milk site in Smeaton Grange. This is a unique opportunity to step into a role that directly influences our environmental impact and how our teams work, grow and keep each other safe every single day.

At The a2 Milk Company, we are building a culture where people and safety come first. As we continue to expand, we are looking for a Safety and Environment Manager who can bring passion, collaboration and expert capability to our manufacturing site.

Reporting to the Plant Manager, with a dotted line to our Group Head of Safety and Group Head of Sustainability, the Safety & Environment Manager will lead the development and implementation of HSE programs across our Smeaton Grange facility.

 

What You’ll Be Doing

In this hands-on role, you will embed a safety-first culture, strengthen our environmental performance, and partner closely with operations, engineering and maintenance teams to drive meaningful, sustainable outcomes.

This role is ideal for someone who thrives in a manufacturing environment, is onsite building strong relationships at all levels while bringing our team members along the safety and environment focused journey through great communication, coaching and collaboration.


What your week could look like;

Safety Leadership

  • Champion a safety-first mindset across the site, building ownership and accountability at every level.
  • Lead and embed our safety systems, reporting processes, SOPs, and risk registers.
  • Conduct risk assessments and drive continuous improvement initiatives.
  • Deliver safety training and develop capability across the teams.
  • Strengthen and support the site safety committee and partner with Engineering on CAPEX projects.

Environmental & Sustainability Initiatives

  • Implement environmental management systems aligned with ISO 14001.
  • Ensure compliance with legislation, licence conditions and internal standards relating to trade waste, water, emissions, energy and waste.
  • Lead initiatives to reduce waste, improve recycling and drive better resource efficiency.
  • Monitor and report environmental metrics and champion site-wide awareness.

Continuous Improvement

  • Lead investigations to identify root causes of safety and environmental issues.
  • Deliver improvement projects that enhance risk reduction and sustainability performance.
  • Be an active member of the site leadership team, shaping operational excellence.


About You

Bring your experience below into a role where you are recognised and rewarded:

  • 5+ Years experience leading safety and environmental programs in a manufacturing environment (FMCG experience will be highly valued)
  • A degree or equivalent experience in Safety, Environmental Science, Engineering, Environmental Management or related discipline.
  • Strong knowledge of WHS and environmental legislation.
  • Experience developing and implementing safety and environmental management systems (ISO 14001 preferred).
  • Outstanding communication, collaboration and influencing skills with the ability to coach, guide and bring people on the safety journey.
  • A proactive, hands-on, problem-solving mindset.
  • Strong stakeholder management and the ability to lead through engagement, not enforcement.
  • Be part of a supportive and collaborative culture where your voice truly matters.


Why join a2 Milk?

The a2 Milk Company Australia is a certified Family Inclusive Workplace committed to improving our team members work life wellbeing with leading policies and practices on flexible work, parental leave, family care and family wellbeing. This role can be worked flexibly, allowing us to support our team members in balancing their personal and professional lives. Our family-friendly culture aims to foster workforce participation, career development, and mental health and wellbeing.

Find out more about our great benefits on our Careers Page.

title: Leading Hand Production
description_html:
Our Story

The a2 Milk Company, driven by science and a pioneering spirit, disrupted the dairy and infant milk formula industry. Our vision is to create an A1-free world where dairy nourishes all people and our planet. We seek to achieve this through the naturally occurring a2 Milk® difference and by promoting a more sustainable approach to dairy. Our premium quality dairy products are enjoyed across Australia and around the globe and we’re just getting started. 

We’re now looking for an experienced Leading Hand to support day-to-day production at our Smeaton Grange manufacturing site (NSW), ensuring high-quality output, safe operations, and strong teamwork on every shift.

What you’ll do

In this hands-on leadership role, you will:

  • Coordinate daily production and warehouse activities to deliver against plan
  • Lead by example championing safety, quality, and a proactive team culture
  • Coach and support production operators to build capability and engagement
  • Troubleshoot issues to maintain production flow and minimise downtime
  • Monitor performance, maintain GMP and hygiene standards, and escalate issues promptly
  • Support CI and Lean initiatives to drive operational excellence
  • Actively participate in incident investigations and quality actions
  • Promote our BOLD values and drive strong communication across shifts

Your leadership will ensure products are made right-first time, safely, and efficiently while building a positive, high-performance culture.

About you

You’ll thrive here if you bring:
- A minimum of 2 years hands-on experience in FMCG / food or dairy manufacturing (essential)
-  Experience coordinating teams or acting in a senior operator/leading hand capacity
- Strong commitment to safety, GMP, HACCP and quality excellence
 - Ability to coach others and build a collaborative, engaged team
 - Problem-solving skills and a proactive, continuous-improvement mindset
- Comfortable working in a fast-paced environment with multiple priorities
- A current forklift licence


This is an exciting opportunity to step into a leadership role with real impact, surrounded by people who care about what they do and the products they make.

Why our Team love coming to work!

  • Work in a values-led, supportive culture
  • Be part of a growing, innovative global dairy business
  • Enjoy career development and training opportunities
  • Competitive salary + benefits
  • Stable work environment with a passionate, quality-driven and proud team

Bring your leadership, passion for quality, and safety mindset to a business making a meaningful difference - apply today!

Why join a2 Milk?

The a2 Milk Company Australia is a certified Family Inclusive Workplace committed to improving our team members work life wellbeing with leading policies and practices on flexible work, parental leave, family care and family wellbeing. This role can be worked flexibly, allowing us to support our team members in balancing their personal and professional lives. Our family-friendly culture aims to foster workforce participation, career development, and mental health and wellbeing.
 

Find out more about our great benefits on our Careers Page.

, ensuring high-quality output, safe operations, and strong teamwork on every shift.
What you’ll do
In this hands-on leadership role, you will:
Coordinate daily production and warehouse activities to deliver against plan
Lead by example championing
safety
,
quality
, and a proactive team culture
Coach and support production operators to build capability and engagement
Troubleshoot issues to maintain production flow and minimise downtime
Monitor performance, maintain GMP and hygiene standards, and escalate issues promptly
Support CI and Lean initiatives to drive operational excellence
Actively participate in incident investigations and quality actions
Promote our
BOLD values
and drive strong communication across shifts
Your leadership will ensure products are made
right-first time
, safely, and efficiently while building a positive, high-performance culture.
About you
You’ll thrive here if you bring:
- A
minimum of 2 years
hands-on experience in
FMCG / food or dairy manufacturing
(essential)
-  Experience coordinating teams or acting in a senior operator/leading hand capacity
- Strong commitment to
safety
,
GMP
,
HACCP
and quality excellence
- Ability to coach others and build a collaborative, engaged team
- Problem-solving skills and a proactive, continuous-improvement mindset
- Comfortable working in a
fast-paced environment
with multiple priorities
- A current forklift licence
This is an exciting opportunity to step into a leadership role with real impact, surrounded by people who care about what they do and the products they make.
Why our Team love coming to work!
Work in a values-led, supportive culture
Be part of a growing, innovative global dairy business
Enjoy career development and training opportunities
Competitive salary + benefits
Stable work environment with a passionate, quality-driven and proud team
Bring your leadership, passion for quality, and safety mindset to a business making a meaningful difference -
apply today!
Why join a2 Milk?
The a2 Milk Company Australia is a certified Family Inclusive Workplace committed to improving our team members work life wellbeing with leading policies and practices on flexible work, parental leave, family care and family wellbeing. This role can be worked flexibly, allowing us to support our team members in balancing their personal and professional lives. Our family-friendly culture aims to foster workforce participation, career development, and mental health and wellbeing.
Find out more about our great benefits on our
Careers Page
.

title: Supply Chain Administrator - 6 month fixed-term contract
description_html:
Our Story

The a2 Milk Company, driven by science and a pioneering spirit, disrupted the dairy and infant milk formula industry. Our vision is to create an A1-free world where dairy nourishes all people and our planet. We seek to achieve this through the naturally occurring a2 Milk® difference and by promoting a more sustainable approach to dairy.


About the Role

We have a newly created role for a customer service champion, with rockstar Excel skills to join our fast-paced, commercial supply chain team supporting our ongoing growth and success in the liquid milk market.

We’re looking for a Supply Chain Administrator with 1–2 years’ experience in an administration or customer-focused role who loves working with data, thrives in a busy environment and is keen to build hands-on experience in supply chain.

This role would suit a graduate with previous work experience in an office ready to step into a growing, global ASX-listed company, or an experienced administrator looking for their next move.

 

What you’ll be doing:

  • Providing customer support to our clients and communicating weekly supply updates
  • Processing and closing customer orders in our ERP system
  • Supporting month-end activities and inventory reconciliation
  • Running reports and working with data (Excel used daily)
  • Liaising with 3PLs, Team Members and internal stakeholders
  • Communicating with internal teams both in person and via email 


More about you:

we are looking for an energetic, people-driven administrator with a 'can do' attitude to bring their skills and enthusiasm into our inclusive team. 

Your experience and skills required are.

  • 1–2 years’ experience in administration, operations or customer service
  • Strong - advanced Excel skills and confidence working with data
  • High attention to detail and a customer-first mindset
  • Comfortable working in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment
  • Interest in supply chain, logistics or operations


What’s on offer:

  • 6-month fixed-term contract
  • Immediate start
  • Supportive, collaborative team environment
  • Real exposure to supply chain operations in a global FMCG business
  • Laptop and Mobile phone provided - 2 x 2 litres of delicious a2 Milk per week - free
  • A fantastic opportunity to work with a growing global company where you can build your skills, confidence and experience within a great team environment.


Hit the Apply Now button and find out more about our great benefits on our Careers Page.
